attributes.tasks: "[{'agent': '\"LinkedIn Lead Scraper\"\\n', 'description': '\"Search and extract leads specifically from LinkedIn.com within the user\\'s business domain using the provided keywords and attributes.  Focus on finding prospects that are directly relevant to the user\\'s industry/domain on LinkedIn.  Use LinkedIn search, company pages, and professional networking features to identify relevant professionals and decision-makers.  Ensure all leads are from LinkedIn profiles of individuals operating in or serving the specified business domain.  Filter out leads that don\\'t match the domain criteria. Try with different search strategies to find leads every time you use the tool\\nUser Input: Business Domain: {domain} Target Clients: {target_clients} Campaign Agenda: {campaign_agenda} Maximum Leads: {max_leads} Search Depth: {search_depth}\\nIMPORTANT: Focus ONLY on LinkedIn.com for lead generation. IMPORTANT: Target to generate at least {max_leads} leads.  Keep generating leads using the search plan and available tools until the maximum number of leads is reached. IMPORTANT: Send only json input to the tools.\\nWORKFLOW: 1. Use \\'Search the internet with Serper\\' to find LinkedIn profiles using site:linkedin.com searches 2. Extract lead information (name, company, title, linkedin_url) from search results 3. Focus on finding high-quality leads with complete information (name, company, title) 4. Email addresses will be found by a separate email finder agent 5. attributes.description:
""Search and extract leads specifically from LinkedIn.com within the user's business domain using the provided keywords and attributes.  Focus on finding prospects that are directly relevant to the user's industry/domain on LinkedIn.  Use LinkedIn search, company pages, and professional networking features to identify relevant professionals and decision-makers.  Ensure all leads are from LinkedIn profiles of individuals operating in or serving the specified business domain.  Filter out leads that don't match the domain criteria. Try with different search strategies to find leads every time you use the tool
User Input: Business Domain: medical devices, doctors Target Clients: ['ceo'] Campaign Agenda: book a demo Maximum Leads: 50 Search Depth: 3
IMPORTANT: Focus ONLY on LinkedIn.com for lead generation. IMPORTANT: Target to generate at least 50 leads.  Keep generating leads using the search plan and available tools until the maximum number of leads is reached. IMPORTANT: Send only json input to the tools.
WORKFLOW: 1. Use 'Search the internet with Serper' to find LinkedIn profiles using site:linkedin.com searches 2. Extract lead information (name, company, title, linkedin_url) from search results 3. Focus on finding high-quality leads with complete information (name, company, title) 4. Email addresses will be found by a separate email finder agent 5. Compile all leads into the required JSON format with email field empty/null "
"

IMPORTANT: Focus ONLY on LinkedIn.com for lead generation. IMPORTANT: Target to generate at least 50 leads.  Keep generating leads using the search plan and available tools until the maximum number of leads is reached. IMPORTANT: Send only json input to the tools.

, expected_output="JSON array of LinkedIn-sourced lead objects with name, email, company, title, and linkedin fields"
), Task(description="Find email addresses for leads using multiple search strategies and sources. For each lead without an email address, search across various online sources to locate their email.
SEARCH STRATEGIES: 1. Company website search: "[Name] [Company] email" or "[Name] @ [Company]" 2. Professional directories: Search for the person on professional platforms 3. Social media: Look for contact information on LinkedIn, Twitter, etc. 4. Industry directories: Search industry-specific directories and databases 5. Conference/event websites: Look for speaker or attendee lists 6. Press releases: Search for company press releases mentioning the person 7. GitHub/technical profiles: For tech professionals, check GitHub profiles 8. If email is not found, try to find the email address of the company by searching the company name of the lead
INPUT: JSON array of leads with name, company, title, and linkedin fields (email field may be empty)
OUTPUT: JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object. If no email is found for a lead, keep the email field empty or null.
IMPORTANT: Use 'Search the internet with Serper' tool to perform searches. IMPORTANT: Focus on finding professional email addresses (company emails preferred over personal). IMPORTANT: Verify email format and validity before including in results. "
, expected_output="JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object"

, expected_output="JSON object with validated leads array, validation summary, and filtered results"

User Input: Business Domain: medical devices, doctors Target Clients: ['ceo'] Campaign Agenda: book a demo "
, expected_output="JSON array of domain-specific email templates with subject, body, and tracking elements"
), Task(description="Analyze email templates for spam risk and deliverability using LLM-based analysis"

User Input: User ID: b501f485-02c3-4cef-a3ef-e394e6e7af4d Username: geethika Email: geethu608@gmail.com Google Authenticated: True

You need to follow the below steps to save the data: 1. Fetch the data from the previous agents (leads and email templates) 2. Clean the data 3. Use the google_sheets_saver tool to save leads data in this format:
   {
     "data": "[{\"name\": \"John Doe\", \"email\": \"john@example.com\", \"company\": \"Tech Corp\"}]",
     "sheet_name": "Leads",
     "user_id": "b501f485-02c3-4cef-a3ef-e394e6e7af4d"

  ],

Prioritize companies showing signs of growth, innovation, or recent strategic moves to align prospects with campaign goals, while expanding gradually to marginal or adjacent segments if necessary.",

}

attributes.description:
""Find email addresses for leads using multiple search strategies and sources. For each lead without an email address, search across various online sources to locate their email.
SEARCH STRATEGIES: 1. Company website search: "[Name] [Company] email" or "[Name] @ [Company]" 2. Professional directories: Search for the person on professional platforms 3. Social media: Look for contact information on LinkedIn, Twitter, etc. 4. Industry directories: Search industry-specific directories and databases 5. Conference/event websites: Look for speaker or attendee lists 6. Press releases: Search for company press releases mentioning the person 7. GitHub/technical profiles: For tech professionals, check GitHub profiles 8. If email is not found, try to find the email address of the company by searching the company name of the lead
INPUT: JSON array of leads with name, company, title, and linkedin fields (email field may be empty)
OUTPUT: JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object. If no email is found for a lead, keep the email field empty or null.
IMPORTANT: Use 'Search the internet with Serper' tool to perform searches. IMPORTANT: Focus on finding professional email addresses (company emails preferred over personal). IMPORTANT: Verify email format and validity before including in results. "
"
attributes.name: "find_lead_emails"

"parent_flow=None name=None cache=True tasks=[Task(description="Search and extract leads specifically from LinkedIn.com within the user's business domain using the provided keywords and attributes.  Focus on finding prospects that are directly relevant to the user's industry/domain on LinkedIn.  Use LinkedIn search, company pages, and professional networking features to identify relevant professionals and decision-makers.  Ensure all leads are from LinkedIn profiles of individuals operating in or serving the specified business domain.  Filter out leads that don't match the domain criteria. Try with different search strategies to find leads every time you use the tool
User Input: Business Domain: medical devices, doctors Target Clients: ['ceo'] Campaign Agenda: book a demo Maximum Leads: 50 Search Depth: 3
IMPORTANT: Focus ONLY on LinkedIn.com for lead generation. IMPORTANT: Target to generate at least 50 leads.  Keep generating leads using the search plan and available tools until the maximum number of leads is reached. IMPORTANT: Send only json input to the tools.
WORKFLOW: 1. Use 'Search the internet with Serper' to find LinkedIn profiles using site:linkedin.com searches 2. Extract lead information (name, company, title, linkedin_url) from search results 3. Focus on finding high-quality leads with complete information (name, company, title) 4. Email addresses will be found by a separate email finder agent 5. Compile all leads into the required JSON format with email field empty/null "
, expected_output="JSON array of LinkedIn-sourced lead objects with name, email, company, title, and linkedin fields"
), Task(description="Find email addresses for leads using multiple search strategies and sources. For each lead without an email address, search across various online sources to locate their email.
SEARCH STRATEGIES: 1. Company website search: "[Name] [Company] email" or "[Name] @ [Company]" 2. Professional directories: Search for the person on professional platforms 3. Social media: Look for contact information on LinkedIn, Twitter, etc. 4. Industry directories: Search industry-specific directories and databases 5. Conference/event websites: Look for speaker or attendee lists 6. Press releases: Search for company press releases mentioning the person 7. GitHub/technical profiles: For tech professionals, check GitHub profiles 8. If email is not found, try to find the email address of the company by searching the company name of the lead
INPUT: JSON array of leads with name, company, title, and linkedin fields (email field may be empty)
OUTPUT: JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object. If no email is found for a lead, keep the email field empty or null.
IMPORTANT: Use 'Search the internet with Serper' tool to perform searches. IMPORTANT: Focus on finding professional email addresses (company emails preferred over personal). IMPORTANT: Verify email format and validity before including in results. "
, expected_output="JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object"
), Task(description="Validate all lead email addresses for deliverability, spam traps, and quality using EmailListVerify API"
, expected_output="JSON object with validated leads array, validation summary, and filtered results"
), Task(description="Generate email templates that are specifically tailored to the user's business domain and target audience.  The templates should include messaging that resonates with prospects in the specific industry/domain provided by the user.  Ensure the content is domain-specific, addressing industry-specific challenges and opportunities,  while maintaining deliverability and tracking capabilities.
User Input: Business Domain: medical devices, doctors Target Clients: ['ceo'] Campaign Agenda: book a demo "
, expected_output="JSON array of domain-specific email templates with subject, body, and tracking elements"
), Task(description="Analyze email templates for spam risk and deliverability using LLM-based analysis"
, expected_output="JSON object with spam score, risk level, content analysis, recommendations, and deliverability tips"
), Task(description="Save leads and email templates created by your previous agents to Google Sheets and campaign strategy/email templates to Google Docs. clean the data before saving it to the google sheets and google docs
User Input: User ID: b501f485-02c3-4cef-a3ef-e394e6e7af4d Username: geethika Email: geethu608@gmail.com Google Authenticated: True
AVAILABLE TOOLS: - google_sheets_saver: Use this tool to save lead data to Google Sheets - google_docs_saver: Use this tool to save email templates to Google Docs
You need to follow the below steps to save the data: 1. Fetch the data from the previous agents (leads and email templates) 2. Clean the data 3. Use the google_sheets_saver tool to save leads data in this format:
   {
     "data": "[{\"name\": \"John Doe\", \"email\": \"john@example.com\", \"company\": \"Tech Corp\"}]",
     "sheet_name": "Leads",
     "user_id": "b501f485-02c3-4cef-a3ef-e394e6e7af4d"
   }
   Note: Use the user_id from the input data to ensure data is saved to the correct user's account.
4. Use the google_docs_saver tool to save email templates in this format:
   {
     "content": "# Campaign Report\n\nThis is a sample campaign report.",
     "document_title": "Q1 Campaign Report",
     "user_id": "b501f485-02c3-4cef-a3ef-e394e6e7af4d"
   }
   Note: Use the user_id from the input data to ensure data is saved to the correct user's account.
5. Return only the file URLs from both tools in JSON format"
, expected_output="JSON object with file URLs and confirmation of data storage. Return only the file urls in the output and nothing else"
)] agents=[Agent(role="LinkedIn Lead Scraper"
, goal="Find and extract high-quality leads specifically from LinkedIn.com within the user's business domain.  Focus on prospects that are directly relevant to the user's industry/domain, filtering out leads that don't match  the domain criteria. Use LinkedIn search and company pages to identify relevant professionals and decision-makers."
, backstory="An expert LinkedIn researcher and data extraction specialist with deep knowledge of LinkedIn's search capabilities,  company pages, and professional networking. Specializes in domain-specific lead generation on LinkedIn,  understanding how to find and identify prospects that are highly relevant to specific business domains  through LinkedIn's professional network."
), Agent(role="Email Address Finder"

attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"task": ""Find email addresses for leads using multiple search strategies and sources. For each lead without an email address, search across various online sources to locate their email.
SEARCH STRATEGIES: 1. Company website search: "[Name] [Company] email" or "[Name] @ [Company]" 2. Professional directories: Search for the person on professional platforms 3. Social media: Look for contact information on LinkedIn, Twitter, etc. 4. Industry directories: Search industry-specific directories and databases 5. Conference/event websites: Look for speaker or attendee lists 6. Press releases: Search for company press releases mentioning the person 7. GitHub/technical profiles: For tech professionals, check GitHub profiles 8. If email is not found, try to find the email address of the company by searching the company name of the lead
INPUT: JSON array of leads with name, company, title, and linkedin fields (email field may be empty)
OUTPUT: JSON array of leads with email addresses found and added to each lead object. If no email is found for a lead, keep the email field empty or null.
IMPORTANT: Use 'Search the internet with Serper' tool to perform searches. IMPORTANT: Focus on finding professional email addresses (company emails preferred over personal). IMPORTANT: Verify email format and validity before including in results. "
", "latest_n": 2}
